detailsOfAchievement: On the 13th of November, 1916 a pioneering effort began that changed the educational landscape of North Karnataka. This was the day the first institution of the KLE Society was established. From humble beginnings rooted in the sacrifice of its founders, the Society now runs over 254 institutions across Karnataka, parts of Maharashtra ranging from kindergarten to post-doctoral research. The underlying philosophy being to encourage individual learning that would transform society. Currently over 1.25,000 students are pursuing their academic dreams in these institutions that impart quality education in areas ranging from School Education Collegiate, Doctoral and Post-doctoral studies in Health Sciences, Agriculture, Engineering, IT, Law, Pharmacy, Nursing, and Management to conventional education in Arts, Science & Commerce. They are inspired by over 16000 accomplished and highly qualified faculty. The UGC accorded Deemed University status to KLE Societyâ€™s J N Medical College, Belagavi and other health science institutions in recognition of the excellent academic standards. The KLE University established in 2006 with eight constituent colleges in the disciplines of Medicine, Dentistry, Nursing, Pharmacy, Physiotherapy and Ayurveda has been reaccredited at the â€œAâ€ level by NAAC for second cycle of five years in 2016. The KLE Universityâ€™s Research Foundation has forged successful collaborations and alliances with 6 National, 14 International Agencies and 19 International Universities from USA, Canada, UK, Europe and South Africa, prominent among them being World Health Organization, National Institutes of Health, USA and Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. In the health sciences domain KLE has signed an MOU with University Sains Malaysia,Penang, to run USM-KLE International Medical Program. Running for past six years at Belagavi currently it has around 500 students on its rolls. KLE Technological University established at Hubballi in 2015 is partnering the â€œMake in Indiaâ€. The KLE Societyâ€™s successful foray into healthcare began with the 2400 beds Dr. Prabhakar Kore Super Speciality Hospital and Research Centre at Belagavi and has now expanded to 4000+ beds medical facilities especially for rural masses. This includes 500 beds Centenary Charitable Hospital, 200 Beds Cancer Hospital 300 Beds Ayurved Hospital, 1700 charitable beds, 60 beds ICU at Chikodi and Rural & urban Primary Health Centres under PPP scheme of Govt. of Karnataka. KLE is the largest private contributor in the region. The health institutions also conduct Free Health Camps across Karnataka and South Maharashtra. Welfare of the farming community is central to the â€œKLE visionâ€. Besides providing educational opportunities to the farming folk KLE also equips farmers for innovative farming practices and adoption of technology through activities of the KLE Krishi Vigyan Kendra, Mattikopp, Belagavi. â€œSwashaktiâ€ the women empowerment cell of KLE University and Family Counselling Centre at Ankola provide vital interventions for the benefit of society at large. KLE â€˜VenuDhwani-90.4 FMâ€™ Belagavi and KLE Dhwani 90.4 FM Hubballi play vital role in disseminating information on health, education and local folklore and culture. Having completed 100 years of service to society, the organization has been instrumental in transforming the educational and healthcare landscape in the region and beyond.

detailsOfAchievement: The Karnataka Health Promotion Trust (KHPT) was formed with a vision to empower marginalised communities to improve their health and reduce the incidence of disease. KHPT has been implementing various health programs in Karnataka, Maharashtra, Rajasthan and coastal Andhra Pradesh. Evidence-based programming; rapid scale up, working in close collaboration with the government at national, state and district level and community participation have been our hallmarks. The core team of directors in KHPT include experts in public health, epidemiology, demography, statistics, communication, training, monitoring and evaluation, NGO management and program implementation, human resource development and finance. KHPT has worked in the area of HIV prevention, care and support projects, addressing gender based violence, TB care and control and improving maternal and neo natal child health in Karnataka. KHPT has implemented a range of community based health interventions in Karnataka, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh and Rajasthan. United Nations Trust Fund to End Violence against Women (UNTFEVAW) has provided KHPT with a project grant from 2011-2014, to address violence against women in sex work in 15 districts of Karnataka. This project addresses violence against women in sex work who experience violence from husband, intimate partners, family, clients, goons, police, society, media, etc and looks at the interface of violence with HIV. The project considers violence as a human rights issue & is implementing the project through community based organizations of female sex workers. Sukshema: Maternal and Child Health (MNCH) (2010-2015) The MNCH project will strengthen existing government health responses towards improving maternal, newborn and child health in 8 underserved districts of North Karnataka. The strategy focuses on expanding the availability and accessibility of critical health interventions for rural populations, improving their quality and coverage, and also increasing demand for maternal, neonatal and child health care services. Sabala is a one year project funded by the World Bank to improve the quality of life for adolescent girls of vulnerable communities of FSW, Devadasiâ€™s and SC community in 72 villages of Bijapur district. Sampoorna (2009-2013) is a project supported by Global Fund to fight Aids, Tuberculosis and Malaria-VII. It seeks to increase HIV/AIDS prevention, care and support for residents of 800 villages across eight high-prevalence districts in Karnataka. Sampoorna currently reaches 6,000 high risk populations, 68,000 vulnerable men and women, 15,000 bridge populations, 1,800 people living with HIV/AIDS (PLHIV) and 650 orphan and vulnerable children (OVC). Sankalp (2003 to 2013) funded by Bills and Melinda Gates Foundation, the first scaled up targeted intervention project for sex workers, MSM and Transgender populations. The project is and aims to reduce STI, increase condom use among sex workers and MSM T and community Mobilization of FSW and MSM-T to participate in an ownership to address activities related to reducing risk and vulnerabilities to HIV which encompasses Violence, stigma and discrimination.The project is being implemented in partnership with NGOs and CBOs.
